title: Disable ''stay/leave page'' dialogues when trying to leave pages
content:
[I use firefox on Mac, Windows, and Android, but the issue seems to effect me mostly on Mac and Windows) I'm just guessing this to be a browse issue. However I won't miond the post being moved to a more relevant sub-forum.

I keep arriving at this solution when searching for a solution to the increasing number of sites using the irritatingly abused stay/leave page question-dialogue box which pops up when i want to leave a page. The common solution appears to be https://userscripts.org/scripts/show/23865 However, when this page loads, I just get an empty box which looks like one of those ones which normally contain scripts to run or stop running certain things, or even to add or embed items etc.

When researching I often need to load lots of pages top go through. however, when i then need to close them all, i end up manually having to complete these irritating dialogies which are OBVIOUSLY really meant for pages where you may be filling in a form, or editing something, and perhaps have not completed filling it in. However, many sites irritatingly abuse this and just add the feature anyway. It just tells yiou they are dodgy rather than trustworthy. Any up-to-date advice as on July 2025? Any trusted new extensions/addons for this as with auto-cookie form-fillers perhaps?
creator: womble.dung

title: Funny behavior with Firefox after connecting an external screen...
content:
Hi... Funny behavior with Firefox after connecting an external screen. First the technical specs: Macbook Air 13" 2017, Os 10.14.5 Mojave. Firefox 115.25.0esr.

So.. I connect an external screen 800 x 480 pix. Then I go to the screen settings to adjust taht little screen. Now everything looks very big on the computer, so I adjust the computer screen in the settings. The desctopp looks normal again, but not Firefox. All open windows have now been squeezed up in the upper left corner and only filling a 4th of the sceen... strange. Apple support couldn't help. Of course I can drag out this windows again manually, this is annoying. Safari is not behaving this way... Somebody tell something.

Thanks in advance. Jesper

title: Firefox Profile Cookie
content: I've 3 Facebook Profile. One Is Default, Second Is Social Media And Third Is Work Profile. All 3 Profiles Settings Are Similar Like Remember History, Remember Cookies, Remember Site Setting Etc. I've Facebook, Twitter, Instagram Login In Social Media Profile. I've Gmail Login In Default Profile Where I Use Google Products. I Dont Have Social Media Accounts Logins In Default Profile But Still In Settings->Privacy & Security->Manage Data. It Shows Facebbook, Instagram, Twitter Cookies And Same Shows In Work Profile. But When I Clear Facebook, Twitter, Instagram Cookies From These Profiles, All Social Accounts Logins Are Automatically Signs out In Social Media Profile But Cookies Shows In Social Media Profile. Another Instance, I've Gmail Login In Default, But Google Cookies Shows In Another Profiles Too. And When I Deletes From Their, Its Logs Me Out Here In Default Profile. So My Question Is, Whats The Point Of Having Facebook Profiles? And Because Of This Reason I've To Set Settings To Remember History. Still, It Logs Me Out From My Accounts. And It Happens Every Single Day. Totally Frustrating, Annoying. And Because Of Frequent Log Out, Login Issue My Google Account Was Blocked By Google. Need Solution On This Issue.
creator: viveks_555

title: Startup page
content:
I had my startup page EXACTLY as I wished with two rows of most often used links to websites. While trying to find a solution to "page jumping" I use Help; "troubleshooting mode" and selected "Restart Firefox in Troubleshooting Mode". It did not solve the page jumping issue but did remove MY customized startup page and I do not how to get it back. I also used "Exit" and restarted Firefox but Firefox set my page to the default start page.

How do I get back to MY old startup page?

This is but one frustrating experience setting up MY computer to perform as I wish ... the computer culture has become "user unfriendly" .... what was once simple is now "too highly geek-ed".

Thanks in advance for your effort in solving yet another Firefox rabbit-hole problem.
creator: joedoksjr

title: Browser Performance Issue When Accessing Restaurant Menus – Any Fix?
content:
Hi Mozilla community,

I’m experiencing some slowdowns in Firefox whenever I browse image-heavy restaurant websites. A recent example is when I tried to open the Tim Hortons lunch menu—the page took longer than usual to load, and some images weren’t displaying properly.

I’ve cleared the cache, checked extensions, and even tried private browsing, but the issue still persists. Could it be a rendering or image handling setting in Firefox that needs adjusting?

For context, here’s the exact page I’m referring to: 👉 https://timhortonsmenuprices.ca/tim-hortons-lunch-menu-with-prices/ – it’s pretty detailed and might help illustrate the problem.

Would appreciate any tips or tweaks to optimize Firefox performance for this kind of content. Thanks!

title: Pocket export not received - possible issue with Mozilla/Pocket account?
content:
I requested my Pocket export three times in June '25 and have received nothing. (Most recent request on 24th June '25, ID: 25174602-3e81-421e-a30d-71ff91dd2d66

I have also contacted Mozilla Support using the contact form twice to raise this issue and didn't receive any confirmation of those support requests to my email address.

The only possible explanation that I can think of is that maybe there has been a problem at the time when Mozilla acquired Pocket and I linked my Pocket account with my Mozilla account. I had previously used a different email address for my Pocket account prior to 2017. I currently have two email addresses (primary and secondary) associated with my Mozilla account but none of these email addresses are showing up in my Pocket settings, only my username. My Mozilla account is the only place where I can see my email addresses listed in my account details but I can't understand why I didn't get the confirmation emails to my Mozilla Support requests.

I used Pocket extensively for work so I really need to get the export. I'd really appreciate some help, thank you.

title: gmail logged out after firefox abrupt shutdown
content:
I'm using Firefox on Ubuntu, and every time the browser crashes and I reopen it, I get the "Start New Session" or "Restore Previous Session" prompt. I’ve tried both options at different times, but in either case, I find myself logged out of Gmail.

This is quite frustrating, especially considering the number of authentication steps required to log back in (e.g., 2FA, verification prompts, etc.).

It seems like session cookies or state information aren’t being properly preserved or restored after a crash. I had high hopes from Firefox in terms of privacy and stability, but this issue is seriously affecting my workflow.

Has anyone else faced this? Is there a way to ensure that sessions (especially login sessions like Gmail) are preserved after a crash?

Any help or suggestions would be appreciated!

title: Accesso ai dati del profilo (password, preferiti, ecc.) dopo ripristino password
content:
Ho utilizzato Firefox desktop da più di vent'anni, più raramente nell'ultimo paio d'anni. Da un po' di tempo non ero loggato su nessuno dei miei device, a causa di nuove installazioni OS ecc. Ho dovuto formattare l'ultimo device che conteneva una cartella profilo e ho quest'oggi ripristinato l'accesso inserendo e-mail e generando una nuova password, perché non avevo la vecchia chiave a portata di mano (tuttavia la posseggo e non l'ho resettata in passato). Non mi pare mi sia stata richiesta ma scopro solo adesso che il semplice login con classico reset password via mail produrrebbe la cancellazione del mio profilo in mirror (che non è presente su nessuno dei miei device per i motivi di cui sopra).

Spero vivamente di sbagliarmi, oltre che un danno per me gravissimo sarebbe la politica di gestione profilo più folle che abbia mai sentito.

Come posso ripristinare i miei dati personali (eventualmente con chiave d'accesso)?

Grazie in anticipo
creator: nicola.sb.bianco
